text: Syed Rayhān ad-Dīn (, ) was a Persian language writer and Sufi of medieval Taraf in Greater Sylhet. He was a prominent member of the Bengali Muslim Syed family of Taraf, in particular the village of Poil. Some of his prominent works include Khvābnāmeh (خوابنامه). He also wrote his own version of the Masnavi-e-Gul-e-Bakāwalī (مثنوى گل بکاولی). His work gained the recognition at the imperial court of Delhi from whom he gained the sobriquet Bulbul-e- Bangālah (; Nightingale of Bengal). ==See also== *Sylhetis ==References== Category:People from Habiganj Sadar Upazila Category:Bengali writers Category:Persian-language writers Category:Indian male writers Category:Indian Muslims Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of death unknown
